sentences.sContent: The Maldives pressed its claim to hold the summit.
sentences.sCn: 马尔代夫一再要求主办这场峰会。

sentences.sContent: Philip feared Edward would lay claim to the Scottish crown.
sentences.sCn: 菲利普担心爱德华会主张自己继承苏格兰王位的权利。

sentences.sContent: the competing claims of parents and teachers
sentences.sCn: 家长和教师各执一词的说法

sentences.sContent: ...anybody can claim themselves to be green...
...The other thing is that a lot of these supplements aren't necessarily what they claim to be...
...So the evidence contradicts the claim that we're mainly suffering from structural unemployment...
...Manufacturers of products that claim to be environmentally friendly will face tighter rules on how they are advertised to consumers under changes proposed by the Federal Trade Commission...
...some people claim that it is a common phenomenon that youngsters spend too much time reading on social networking websites...
...What is the author's comment on Krugman's claim about the current drought in America's Midwest...
...which is increasingly being used to claim new life forms as private property...
...You claim you are traveling on a scholarship from Delhi University...
...Why do some non-native speakers of English claim that it’s a difficult language to learn...
...Some claim that it is beneficial for children’s development...

synos.tran: 要求；声称；[贸易]索赔；断言；值得

phrases.pCn: 剩余权益；[经]剩余索偿权
行李认领；领取行李；取行李处
索赔申请表；催询单；催缺通函
未定权益；或有求偿权；附带要求
由于损坏而索赔；赔偿损害要求

words.tran: 原告；[贸易] 索赔人；提出要求者

trans.tranOther: a right to do something or to have something, especially because it belongs to you or because you deserve it
